description.plain:
Jarryd James is a singer-songwriter and producer from Brisbane, Australia.

He released his debut single “Do You Remember” on 30 January 2015. James and producer Joel Little wrote Do You Remember earlier that year in an apartment the Kiwi was renting while he looked for a longer-term base in LA.

In an interview with The West Australian he told that classic singers and songwriters including Harry Nilsson, the Beatles, the Eagles, Stevie Wonder and the Doobie Brothers were his soundtrack growing up, while “everyone else was listening to Nirvana and Metallica”.

While classically trained on the trumpet and proficient on guitar and piano, shyness held him back from singing until he was 20. “I was so shy. It took me a while to get the courage to sing in front of anyone. When I started singing, then I started writing as well.”

body.plain:
Jarryd James is a singer-songwriter and producer from Brisbane, Australia.

He released his debut single “Do You Remember” on 30 January 2015. James and producer Joel Little wrote Do You Remember earlier that year in an apartment the Kiwi was renting while he looked for a longer-term base in LA.

In an interview with The West Australian he told that classic singers and songwriters including Harry Nilsson, the Beatles, the Eagles, Stevie Wonder and the Doobie Brothers were his soundtrack growing up, while “everyone else was listening to Nirvana and Metallica”.

While classically trained on the trumpet and proficient on guitar and piano, shyness held him back from singing until he was 20. “I was so shy. It took me a while to get the courage to sing in front of anyone. When I started singing, then I started writing as well.”

songs.full_title: Do You Remember by Jarryd James
songs.title: Do You Remember

description.plain:
Do You Remember is Jarryd James' debut single, released in early January, 2015. The first radio air play was on the Triple J ‘Home and Hosed’ show on the 13th of January.
It was released on iTunes on the 30th of January, and reached #1 in the Australia chart in late March.
The official music video was released on March 8.

It was released on iTunes on the 30th of January, and reached #1 in the Australia chart in late March.

songs.full_title: Do You Remember (Grey Remix) by Jarryd James
songs.title: Do You Remember (Grey Remix)

songs.lyrics:
11 ContributorsDo You Remember Lyrics[Verse 1]
When did we lose our way?
Easier to let it go, oh
So many can't tell anybody
Harder to let you know

[Pre-Chorus]
Call me when you made up your mind, but you won't
Caught up in the way that you played my heart
Only love could ever hit this hard

[Chorus]
Oh don't be scared about it
Don't forget it was real
Do you remember the way it made you feel
Do you remember the things it let you feel?

[Verse 2]
How do I make you stay
When it's easier to let you go, oh
Nobody knows what we know about it
No one needs to know

(Call me, C-Call me)

[Pre-Chorus]
Call me when you made up your mind, but you won't
Caught up in the way that you played my heart
Only love could ever hit this hard
You might also like[Chorus]
Oh don't be scared about it
Don't forget it was real
Do you remember the way it made you feel
Do you remember the things it let you feel?


[Bridge]
When you love to your limit
You gave all you're given
Who you're gonna pray to when you're there
When you find out that there ain't no other love, no other love for you, oh

[Chorus]
Oh don't be scared about it
Don't forget it was real
Do you remember the way it made you feel
Do you remember the things it let you feel?
(Do you remember)

[Outro]
Oh, when you think about it
Do you remember me, oh
Do you remember the way it made you feel
Do you remember the things it let you feel?25Embed

songs.title: 1000X

description.plain:
“1000x” is a track from Jarryd James' upcoming sophomore album and features vocals from Georgia Nott of New Zealand duo Broods. It received it’s first play on BBC Radio 1 on June 16, 2016.

Georgia revealed  that she loved the track so much she walked down the aisle at her wedding to a demo version of it.

Take me away

I don't wanna say we didn't try for everything that's in our hearts
How do we do it, oh, how do we make it?
Oh no no no no

[Verse 2]
Too many nights without warmth in my arms again

Oh, heart on my sleeve and my mind is on you and the way we're gon' be
No one can save us, no one can save us but me
